definitions.definition: to make cloth by repeatedly crossing a single thread through two sets of long threads on a loom (= special frame):
examples: This type of wool is woven into fabric which will make jackets.

definitions.definition: to twist long objects together, or to make something by doing this:
examples: We were shown how to roughly weave ferns and grass together to make a temporary shelter.

definitions.definition: to form something from several different things or to combine several different things, in a complicated or skilled way:
examples: The biography is woven from the many accounts which exist of things she did.

definitions.definition: the way in which cloth has been woven, for example with the threads pulled firmly together, or the pattern produced by this process:
